str2: Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Rama, a place in Ephraim, two hours north of Jerusalem. Of Hebrew origin; Rama, a place in Palestine.
Weeping, lamentation, crying. From klaio; lamentation.
Lamentation, wailing, mourning, sorrow. From a derivative of the base of duno; moaning, i.e. Lamentation.
Rachel, younger wife of the patriarch Jacob. Of Hebrew origin; Rachel, the wife of Jacob.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To weep, weep for, mourn, lament. Of uncertain affinity; to sob, i.e. Wail aloud.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
